revised_title: Dielectric Constants and Heats of Mixing in Associated Solutions
tldr: The authors studied the dielectric constants and heats of mixing in associated solutions, specifically piperidine/tetrahydropyran, piperidine/cyclohexane, and tetrahydropyran/cyclohexane. They found that all three systems are associated and have endothermic heats of mixing, suggesting that N-H hydrogen bonds are involved. The authors also provided evidence of hydrogen bond formation using nuclear magnetic resonance spectra.
